title: Gaya schoolgirl raped, physically challenged accused held | india-news | Hindustan Times
text:
Gaya schoolgirl raped, physically challenged accused held india Updated: Feb 21, 2017 18:25 IST Anil Kumar Ojha Hidustan Times, Gaya The Class 10 girl was allegedly raped while returning home from school farewell function in Bihar’s Gaya district. 
When she visited school for her farewell function on Monday, little did Kusum Kumari (name changed) realise that her last day in school would turn into a nightmare. 
On way back home from school at Manpur in Bihar’s Gaya town, 115km from state capital Patna, the Class 10 girl was allegedly raped by a physically challenged man, who is also the brother of her friend. 
The accused has since been arrested and was being interrogated while the victim has been admitted at Anugrah Narain Magadh Medical College and Hospital here. 
In her statement to police, the victim said she had gone to her friend’s house after the school function. When she was leaving for her house, her friend’s brother offered to accompany her, the girl said. “He took me to a secluded place and forced me to drink a beverage laced with intoxicant,” she said. 
Police said an autorickshaw driver informed them of the incident after he spotted the unconscious girl lying in a bush by roadside. The accused, identified as Mantu Yadav, had apparently dumped the girl in the bush after raping her and fled, the police added. 
The accused is an autorickshaw driver, the police said. 
The father of the victim, who runs a dairy in Vishnupad police station area here, said he was initially reluctant to allow his daughter, who would be appearing for Class 10 CBSE examination next month, to go for the farewell party. “We allowed her to go to school following persistent request by her friend, the sister of the rape accused, who had come to our house on Monday afternoon. We got worried when she did not return by 4pm as promised. In the evening, an unknown caller informed us that our daughter had met with an accident. When we reached the hospital, the police and the doctors told us about the actual incident,” he said. 
He also demanded capital punishment for the accused. 
Gaya senor superintendent of police (SSP) Garima Malik said she immediately set up a special investigating team (SIT), headed by ASP Baliram Chaudhary, to probe the case and ensure the arrest of the alleged culprit. Confirming the arrest, the SSP said the police had been directed to make out a strong case against the accused and submit the chargesheet at the earliest.
